data.chText: （不顾责任、义务等）离弃，遗弃，抛弃
data.enText: to leave sb, especially sb you are responsible for, with no intention of returning

data.chText: 这个婴儿被母亲遗弃了。
data.enText: The baby had been abandoned by its mother.

data.chText: 研究表明，老人十分害怕被丢给陌生人照管。
data.enText: The study showed a deep fear among the elderly of being abandoned to the care of strangers.
to leave a thing or place, especially because it is impossible or dangerous to stay

data.chText: 大雪迫使许多驾驶者弃车步行。
data.enText: Snow forced many drivers to abandon their vehicles.

data.chText: 他们不得不舍弃土地，让侵略军占领。
data.enText: They had to abandon their lands to the invading forces.

data.chText: 他下令弃船（因船快要沉没）。
data.enText: He gave the order to abandon ship (= to leave the ship because it was sinking) .

data.chText: 停止（支持或帮助）；放弃（信念）
data.enText: to stop supporting or helping sb; to stop believing in sth

data.chText: 战后该国人民不再拥护他们的政治领袖。
data.enText: The country abandoned its political leaders after the war.

data.chText: 1930年时他已放弃了马克思主义信念。
data.enText: By 1930 he had abandoned his Marxist principles.
to stop doing sth, especially before it is finished; to stop having sth

data.chText: 因为下雨，他们中止了比赛。
data.enText: They abandoned the match because of rain.

data.chText: 她对和解已不再抱有希望。
data.enText: She abandoned hope of any reconciliation.
to feel an emotion so strongly that you can feel nothing else
He abandoned himself to despair.
an uncontrolled way of behaving that shows that sb does not care what other people think

data.chText: 他无所顾忌地乱开支票。
data.enText: He signed cheques with careless abandon.
with gay abandon
without thinking about the results or effects of a particular action

simple_means.memory_skill: a 加强 + ban 禁止 + don 给予 → 禁止给 → 放弃

means: (不顾责任、义务等)离弃，遗弃，抛弃

ex.chText: 他抛弃了妻子，拿走了他们所有的钱财。
ex.enText: He abandoned his wife and took all their money.

ex.chText: 船长向所有人下令放弃正在燃烧的船只。
ex.enText: The captain ordered everyone to abandon the burning ship.

synonyms.bx: 强调永远并完全放弃，不论自愿与否，也可能是为了逃避责任。

ex.chText: 女王不打算让位。
ex.enText: The Queen has no intention of abdicating her throne.

ex.chText: 英王爱德华八世于1936年退位。
ex.enText: King Edward VIII abdicated in 1936.

ex.chText: 他抛弃妻子后，和一位日本姑娘结婚了。
ex.enText: He deserted his wife and married a Japanese girl.

ex.chText: 那位母亲生下男婴后不久就把他遗弃了。
ex.enText: The mother deserted the baby boy soon after giving birth.

synonyms.bx: 多指放弃从前的职业、伙伴、伴侣及监护人资格等，有时带有内疚感。

ex.chText: 他取消了访问纽约的决定。
ex.enText: He has given up his decision to visit New York.

ex.chText: 我要辞去这份工作。
ex.enText: I'll give up the job.

synonyms.bx: 普通用语，强调终止做某事，通常用来表示放弃某个计划、设计、工作、职位等。

ex.chText: 他想戒烟。
ex.enText: He wants to quit smoking.

ex.chText: 如果不给我加薪，我就不干了。
ex.enText: If I don't get a pay rise, I'll quit.

synonyms.bx: 常指停止做于己不利或伤害他人的事。

ex.chText: 他正式声明放弃公民权利。
ex.enText: He renounced his citizenship.

ex.chText: 她宣布放弃自己的宗教信仰。
ex.enText: She renounced her religion.

synonyms.bx: 表示正式声明放弃职位、官衔、权力等。

ex.chText: 他只好放弃在议会的投票权。
ex.enText: He had to waive his right to vote in Parliament.

ex.chText: 地方政府拒绝取缔其规定。
ex.enText: The local government refused to waive its rules.

synonyms.bx: 表示正式宣布放弃权利、要求，或宣布取消规则、规定等。

ex.chText: 飞往纽约的班机取消了。
ex.enText: The flight to New York was cancelled.

ex.chText: 建大坝的项目取消了。
ex.enText: The project to build the dam was cancelled.

synonyms.bx: 指取消已安排或决定好的计划等。

ex.chText: 他已经放弃了一切希望。
ex.enText: He had abandoned all hopes.

ex.chText: 由于缺乏资金，他们中止了这项工程。
ex.enText: They abandoned the project due to lack of funds.

synonyms.bx: 指因困难太多、无法继续下去而放弃做某事。

ex.chText: 他们停止了谈话。
ex.enText: They dropped their talk.

ex.chText: 放下所有的事情立即到这里来。
ex.enText: Drop everything and come here immediately.

data.enText: with gay abandon
without thinking about the results or effects of a particular action

tr: the trait of lacking restraint or control
reckless freedom from inhibition or worry
a feeling of extreme emotional intensity

example: He abandoned the thought of asking for her hand in marriage
Both sides have to give up some claims in these negotiations

tr: leave someone who needs or counts on you

example: You must vacate your office by tonight

tr: give up with the intent of never claiming again
example: She gave up her children to her ex-husband when she moved to Tahiti
We gave the drowning victim up for dead
We abandoned the old car in the empty parking lot

value.def: If you abandon a place, thing, or person, you leave the place, thing, or person permanently or for a long time, especially when you should not do so.

example.ex: He claimed that his parents had abandoned him...
The road is strewn with abandoned vehicles.
example.tran: 道路上满是弃置的车辆。

value.def: If you abandon an activity or piece of work, you stop doing it before it is finished.

example.ex: The authorities have abandoned any attempt to distribute food...
example.tran: 当局中止了分发食物的尝试。

example.ex: The scheme's investors, fearful of bankruptcy, decided to abandon the project.
example.tran: 因为担心破产，该计划的投资者决定放弃这个项目。

value.tran: 中途放弃，中止（活动、工作等）

value.def: If you abandon an idea or way of thinking, you stop having that idea or thinking in that way.

example.ex: Logic had prevailed and he had abandoned the idea.
example.tran: 最终理智占了上风，他打消了那个念头。

value.def: If you abandon yourself to an emotion, you think about it a lot and feel it strongly, especially when other people might think you are wrong to do so.

example.ex: We are scared to abandon ourselves to our feelings in case we seem weak or out of control.
example.tran: 我们不敢放纵自己的情感，以免显得太过软弱或缺乏自制。

value.def: If you say that someone does something with abandon, you mean that they behave in a wild, uncontrolled way and do not think or care about how they should behave.

example.ex: He has spent money with gay abandon...
Their permissiveness toward their children reflects the wild abandon of their own lives.
example.tran: 他们对孩子的放任折射出他们自身生活的放浪形骸。

value.def: If people abandon ship, they get off a ship because it is sinking.

example.ex: The officers and crew prepared to abandon ship in an orderly fashion.
example.tran: 全体船员秩序井然地准备弃船。

partsOfSpeech.dec: a 加强 + ban 禁止 + don 给予 → 禁止给 → 放弃
ban 禁止 + al …的 → 被禁止的 → 陈腐的
ban 禁止 + ish 使… → 禁止〔入境〕→ 驱逐
ban 禁止 + ister 表人或物 → 禁止入内 → 栏杆
